trial_identification.studytitle: vaginal surgery for uterine prolapse in low resource countries using a new technique
trial_identification.scientifictitle: vaginal hysterectomy with sacrospinous ligament fixation using needle holder in low resource countries for uterine prolapse

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other reproductive health and childbirth disorders

interventions.interventions: vaginal hysterectomy with unilateral right sacrospinous ligament fixation will be performed using long needle holder through long posterior vaginal wall incision and suturing back of the cervix to the ligament using vicryl one suture ,the surgery will be performed in shatby maternity university hospital,Alexandria university ,egypt. the surgery will be done by a gynecologist with 5 years of experience .the approximate duration of the procedure is 1.5 hour

primaryOutcome.outcome: failure rate by recurrence of symptoms and examination from medical records .
primaryOutcome.timepoint: recurrence of prolapse 3 month,6 month and ,one year after surgery

secondaryOutcome.outcome: complications as needle injury to the physician,blood loss,hematoma with blood transfusion and chronic pelvic pain from medical records
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: during surgery ,baseline,one week after surgery ,and 3 month after surgery

secondaryOutcome.outcome: duration of surgery from medical records

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: 1.second and third degree uterine prolapse . 2.HCV,HBV,HIV negative 3.not desiring fertility 4.no coital complains

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: shatby maternity university hospital,department of obstetrics and gynecology,alexandria egypt.20255

fundingsource.fundingaddress: shatby maternity university hospital,department of obstetrics and gynecology,alexandria egypt.20255

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: shatby maternity university hospital,department of obstetrics and gynecology,alexandria egypt.20255

ethicsAndSummary.summary: this was a prospective study where vaginal hysterectomy with right sacrospinous ligament fixation were done for uterine prolapse .the outcomes were duration of surgery , complications and recurrence encountered.

ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: shatby maternity university hospital,department of obstetrics and gynecology,alexandria egypt.20255
